required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Evaluation of Chenopodium Formosanum and Fagopyrum Esculentum Extract on Anti-aging Effect
clinical_study.official_title: The Evaluation of Chenopodium Formosanum and Fagopyrum Esculentum Extract on Anti-aging Effect

brief_summary.textblock: To assess Chenopodium Formosanum and Fagopyrum Esculentum Extract on skin anti-aging

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin moisture at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Corneometer® CM825 is utilized to measure skin moisture. Units: arbitrary Corneometer® units 0-120

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin elasticity at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Cutometer® dual MPA 580 is utilized to measure skin elasticity (parameter R2). Units: μm penetration depth into the probe opening, expressed as curves

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin wrinkles at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: 3D Full-Face Skin Analyzer IRV is utilized to measure wrinkles. Units: arbitrary units

primary_outcome.measure: The change of skin collagen density
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin collagen density at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: DermaLab® combo - 20 MHz High Freq. Ultrasound probe is utilized to scan and analyze skin collagen density. Units: Intensity score

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin tone at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: 3D Full-Face Skin Analyzer IRV was utilized to measure skin tone. Units: arbitrary units

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin brightness at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: 3D Full-Face Skin Analyzer IRV is utilized to measure skin brightness. Units: arbitrary units

primary_outcome.measure: The change of skin melanin index
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin melanin index at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Mexameter® MX 18 is utilized to measure skin melanin index. Units: arbitrary Mexameter® units (0-999)

primary_outcome.measure: The change of skin L*a*b* value
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin L*a*b* value at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Color Spectrophotometer SCM-104/108 is utilized to measure skin L*a*b* value. Units: arbitrary units

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of transepidermal water loss (TEWL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline TEWL at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Tewameter® TM 300 is utilized to measure transepidermal water loss. Units: g/hm²

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin texture at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: 3D Full-Face Skin Analyzer IRV is utilized to measure skin texture. Units: arbitrary units

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin pores at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: 3D Full-Face Skin Analyzer IRV is utilized to measure skin pores. Units: arbitrary units

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin spots at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: 3D Full-Face Skin Analyzer IRV is utilized to measure skin spots. Units: arbitrary units

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of skin erythema level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin erythema level at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mexameter® MX 18 is utilized to measure skin erythema level. Units: arbitrary Mexameter® units (0-999)
Questionnaire is utilized to assess skin condition of the subjects. Units: score

arm_group.arm_group_label: Chenopodium Formosanum and Fagopyrum Esculentum Extract drink

intervention.description: consume 2 bottle (30 mL) per day for 56 days

intervention.intervention_name: Chenopodium Formosanum and Fagopyrum Esculentum Extract drink
intervention.description: consume 2 bottle (30 mL) per day for 56 days
intervention.arm_group_label: Chenopodium Formosanum and Fagopyrum Esculentum Extract drink

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adults aged between 20-65 years old
- Subjects must read and sign the informed consent form after the study has been fully explained.
- Subjects are willing to cooperate and comply with all of the regulation during the trial.
- Subject should inform to investigator immediately if adverse effect is happened.
- Subjects are willing to avoid UV overexposure during the trial (include indoor tanning treatment).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have known cosmetic, drug or food allergies.
- Subjects who have severe desquamation, tattoo, sunburn, peeling skin or other skin condition might impact measurement.
- Subjects with any physical condition judged by the researcher not to be eligible for this study.
- Subjects with uncontrollable physical condition such as high blood pressure, thyroid disease, diabetes, etc.
- Female who is pregnant or nursing or planning to become pregnant during the course of the study.
- Those who are currently participating in other clinical trials or who have just concluded a clinical trial two weeks ago.
- Women who have started contraceptive or change current hormone contraceptive methods within 3 months.
